Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Emeka K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in tatters. The paint is peeling off the walls and it has dodgy old furniture, musty carpets and curtains. It's so dusty that it made a friend of mine with a dust allergy quite ill. The rooms are tiny. Be prepared to be ripped off when it comes to the internet. They charge outrageous fees for access to their WiFi, notwithstanding that internet can be obtained very cheaply by hotel businesses these days. I raised the concern with the manageress of the hotel in the first instance to give her the opportunity to make this right and was met with an incredibly rude, surly and impatient manner. She certainly does not meet any basic minimum standard in customer service. I cannot imagine how this person treats her staff if this is how she treats her customers, and that can only make for unhappy staff and an even worse experience for guests visiting the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good, but a bit outdated”
Reviews.Author: H S
Reviews.Content: + Breakfast + Nice and calm borough + Staff + Underground station + Bathroom - Time-worn/outdated (door, carpet, paint) - Not much to see on walking distance (must take the tube) - We had a small room

Reviews.Title: “POOR !!!! -- 'nough said !”
Reviews.Author: Effem83
Reviews.Content: GOD ! It was really difficult to imagine that a room could be THIS small !! I booked 2 double rooms and honestly, they must have a truly professionally manipulative photographer but the rooms were cramped, tiny, suffocating and uncomfortable to say the least !! I asked for a table fan in the room since it was the middle of summer and the windows dont open more than 3 inches... the guy turns up 45 mins later with a tiniest of fans.... sent back to get a bigger one and literally didnt have ANYWHERE in the room to put it !!! APPALLING !!! IN EVERY ASPECT !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and loud”
Reviews.Author: Marie-Anne G
Reviews.Content: I didn't think that a room that small could exist. Now I understand what a cabin room means (6x10). The bathroom was tiny, but well organized and clean. The bed was comfortable. On a negative note, there was some work being done in the hotel. No one warned me and workers were going at in starting at 8 AM everyday, including weekends. Extremely loud noises were being made in the morning, at at night, I actually.. heard the neighbors. Not much sleep for me at this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Older budget hotel, but still nice.”
Reviews.Author: DrTom234
Reviews.Content: I ended up in London unexpectedly after my travel plans changed at the last minute and I didnâ€™t have hotel reservations. I checked at the Hotel Info booth a Heathrow and asked for a moderately priced hotel that was easy to get to and was located in an area that would allow some sightseeing. They made the reservations for this hotel. They knew it was my first time in London and I had not used the tube before. This hotel is two blocks from the Gloucester Station which meant that we would not need to change trains on the line from the airport. It took about 45 minutes to get there on the tube and that cost about $15 USD. We were told that a taxi ride there would have cost nearly $95 USD which sounded too steep for me. We had a map to the hotel from the station, but it still took us a bit to find the hotel as there is no sign out front and it is a block off the main roads. I had to ask for directions and I was literally in front of the hotel. It blends into the rowhouses and you donâ€™t realize it is a hotel unless you look at the front door. This is an old hotel â€“ over a century old according to the framed newspaper story on the wall. The lobby is cramped and the carpet on the stairs is threadbare with some holes in it. There is a small bar and sitting area on the first floor, but I never saw more than 1-2 people in that lounge. Check in was efficient and the bellboys were friendly and attentive. We were given a room on the ground floor. The room was a bit larger than a standard room with large windows â€“ since we were on the ground floor, anyone walking on the sidewalk could look into our room so we needed to keep the curtains closed. You could hear conversations from people walking by. The bed was comfortable, the room had a CRT television, and Wi-fi was free and easily accessible. The bathroom was very cramped and the tub had areas where the lining was rubbed off. You had a large step into the tub for a shower which felt precarious when the floor was wet. Breakfast was included with our stay. They had a night restaurant attached to the lobby with hot and cold breakfast with attentive wait-staff and good, although basic, food. I liked the location of this hotel. It is in walking distance to the London Museum and other museums and if you donâ€™t mind walking a bit further, you can get to the shopping district. The tube stop is 3 blocks away and is surrounded by a grocery store and several fast food and sit down restaurants as well as a pharmacy. From the tube you can get pretty much everywhere, so I thought the location was great for my tours of Westminster Abby, the Tower of London, and Buckingham Palace. There is a Westin, a Holiday Inn, and several other chain hotels in the area and all of them look nicer that the Strathmore. However, they are quite a bit more expensive. I think the Strathmore was a good alternative for the budget minded traveler who is willing to bypass some of the luxury items and settle for an older but clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, decent chain”
Reviews.Author: rigatone
Reviews.Content: We used to live in London and know the city well. We have also stayed in Grange Blooms before and enjoyed that too. Grange Strathmore is in a good location for tourists. They can catch a bus going past the museums near South Kensington and on to the West End, or Gloucester Road tube station is 2 minutes away. The views are on a quiet but well to do residential street of London. The hotel itself was well priced for a double room including continental breakfast. The staff were very friendly, accommodating and the room itself was ideal. Great night's sleep, good breakfast, nice ambience and quiet at night. The Travelodge's were the same price and this is very much a step above them. Next time we stay over on a visit, we'll stick to a Grange hotel. Takes you a while to find a chain you trust but haven't had a bad stay with them

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Well Placed.”
Reviews.Author: travelperth_12
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after being disappointed at the hotel provided by our tour group company. Arriving post tour after booking 2 weeks prior we were told that the hotel was overbooked, (31st december 2011) and we were offered a family room instead of our 2 doubles and they included free breakfast. The room was very comfortable and clean, although the bathroom was small and a couple of the tiles were broken. The hotel is a little tired and worn, but full of character and the staff were polite and very helpful. The concierge was wonderful and very helpful. The Grange Strathmore is in a great position to access all the museums and the city is a ten minute taxi ride at a cost of 12 pounds sterling or a tube ride of 4 stations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Mary G
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant one night stay here for a good price. The staff are very friendly and polite which is always good and breakfast was fine. The hotel is just 100 yards down a side road so beautifully quite yet easy to get to the tube for access anywhere across London. The room was compact but the bed was very clean and comfortable. We did find the bathroom a little drafty and that could have been updated a bit as could the main hallway but overall we thought it was good value for money when combined with a theatre break.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again but think the luxury tag stretching it a bit...”
Reviews.Author: Rustyplough
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a pleasant relaxing stay in London then in my view this hotel should be considered. It is in an excellent location for getting around London, close to the Gloucester Road tube â€“ District, Circle and Piccadilly Lines tube - yet in quiet enough an area to get some sleep. Being an old London terraced building it is very closed in, youâ€™d suffer a bit if you were claustrophobic - their website makes great use of wide angle lens shots - and has a lot of varying floor levels so if mobility is an issue take care. Rooms are nice enough, well equipped and clean, small and perhaps a bit dark but that down to age and design of the building, they are not the square box with corner bathrooms and all chrome, concealed lighting and fake wood of the Holiday Inn/ Hilton chains. Massive radiators - it was very cold weather when I stayed - my radiators were hidden behind thick curtains and blackout blinds so you have to do the â€œtuck behindâ€� thing when you go to bed, if you want to wake up to a warm room. At least you could open the windows for some fresh air if you felt like it, again unlike many more modern hotels. Lovely relaxing bar area with sumptuous chairs and settees AND drink prices very reasonable â€“ this in fact is probably the hotelâ€™s best feature and a great place to end a busy day in London. Staff are excellent and could not try and do more for you. Only downside is their strange and annoying system at breakfast. I can see the reason for it as I am sure many London hotels get ripped off by guests booking room only and then slipping in for breakfast but you have to go through the third degree at your table - after being checked out at breakfast room reception - before they think about giving you anything. Well, that should be the system; I admit I did lose it slightly and asked that I at least got a coffee before the interrogation began. I got the coffee and they didn't seem to hold it against me - I know, never annoy people serving you food...... I was lucky enough to be able to get up and have breakfast late, I think that if Iâ€™d been on a more pressing business trip the system would have really annoyed me! I do think though that the Luxury Hotel tag is stretching it a bit too far but all in all I'd stay again, I perhaps prefer their sister hotel, The Grange Rochester, for its location near Victoria, but the Strathmore is more relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Small but so comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: reviewedbyk
Reviews.Content: I stayed her with my mom when she came to visit me in London. Having lived in London for the 2 prior months, I was used to the smaller living spaces and therefore was not surprised by the size of our room. So be aware to those who do not like small spaces. We shared a room with 2 twin beds and it was snug...BUT one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. I prefer soft beds and this was the crÃ¨me de la crÃ¨me of beds. It felt like sleeping inside a marshmallow on top of a cloud. The rooms were clean, we had a nice view, and the hotel was quiet. There is also a lovely sitting area and restaurant downstairs and the staff is very friendly. We arrived lated from Rome and there was staff ready to accept us and they offered to open the kitchen to fix us a snack if we were hungry! If you are going to be spending your whole day in bed, it might not be the best hotel, but it sure is a great one for the night and you can't beat the price for such a wonderful location and neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “The dreaded basement rooms!”
Reviews.Author: nuttynag
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before approx 5 years ago and found it very satisfactory so we decided to stay again as it is ideally placed with easy access for the tube, sights & shopping. When we arrived it looked like nothing had been touched since our last visit ie, decor and carpets. We were given room number 5 on the basement level of the hotel. The room was very small but adequate so we went straight out. On returning that evening on closer inspection the wall paper was ripped & peeling on the walls, paint work around the window was flaking & mouldy plus dirty, stained skirting boards. in the bathroom all the silicone around the shower tray was covered in mould & had no seal between the shower door and the wall so when you had a shower the water leaked straight onto the floor, that was only if you enjoyed a cold shower as the water was just about tepid morning & night The first morning we were woken very early with staff banging and talking directly outside the bedroom window as this is where the house keeping storage must be. On the second morning we were woken at 6.03am with what sounded like boxes being thrown down up or down the metal stairs. Breakfast was sparse to say the least at a cost of Â£16.00 each. Choice of cheese, jams, ham, juice etc. When checking out I mentioned how disappointed we were as the hotel was described as a luxury 4*. The receptionist just said sorry and shrugged her shoulders, I had to ask for a comments card. Once again the location of this hotel cannot be faulted. It certainly is not a 4* hotel given it's current state. I don't think that threadbare & torn carpets plus ripped wall paper & mouldy bathrooms are acceptable. Will not stay again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Mollie5555
Reviews.Content: Ive read lots of reviews of this hotel and a lot of what they say is true. However I've now stayed here on 4 occasions and will stay again. It's location is brilliant (for me anyway). On the picadilly line for Heathrow travellers. It is very close to the Royal Albert Hall, the Natural History Museum, the Vic & Albert, Kensington Palace and I could go on and on. On many transport routes both rail and bus and only a short taxi ride to theatre land and central London. Yes the lift is small, but why is that a problem. Yes when in the room you can hear some noise at some time from the hall. I have yet to stay in a hotel that you can't no matter what the standard. The rooms are always clean and the breakfasts more than adequate. I could have done with a few more plug sockets in my room. In these days of needing to recharge things this is a must for me. The staff are brilliant. Always friendly and exceedingly helpful. As I travel on my own quite often this is always great and I've always felt welcomed and safe here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: KiowaVT
Reviews.Content: While my friend had a major plumbing issue, management followed up on it. I had no issues. Small rooms. Some mentioned bad service but simply everyone I met working there was nice. Desk, housekeeping, concierge, the works. Elegant, but not luxury. Location is great. Breakfast was fine. No gym, and they usually charge for internet access. A few things could be improved, but no major gripes from me.

Reviews.Title: “"Little and Lovely"”
Reviews.Author: BritInside
Reviews.Content: I quite enjoyed my stay. I just wish I had found this gem sooner. I had booked this room from Heathrow as I had missed my flight back to the States and wanted to stay in the city for the extra day to be closer to the shops/attractions (spent too much time traveling back and forth from the Edwardian near the airport). For 100GBP I think I did okay, especially location-wise; Plenty of areas of interest just around the corner. From the time I arrived around 11am I felt welcome even though I was a little early for check-in. This was no problem for the friendly staff and the concierge stored my luggage for me so that I was able to catch a few local sites while I waited for my room; which was ready earlier than promised, I might add. The entrance was very nice and I actually liked the charming plaid carpet throughout leading to the front desk as well as the masculine front parlor where I spent some time relaxing later on. After a short but tight ride in the lift, I got to my room which was shockingly tiny, but I was only in there to sleep, right? I was in London, for goodness sake! I must say that being in love with the city allowed me to overlook what some might demand a refund for, such as: the awkward layout, small bed, seemingly dated decor, miniscule en suite, dodgy wifi and lack of central air on a sticky day. Honestly, you can't expect all brand new amenities in a historical establishment, can you? All in all, if you're a picky, likes-everything-shiny type of person, this hotel is not for you. But, if you're an individual that can appreciate a cozy atmosphere in a treasured building and location, then you're in the right place.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: simoninireland
Reviews.Content: This is a small, high-service hotel in the heart of the museum district of central London, around the corner from the Natural History Museum, the Science Museum, the V&A, and Imperial College. The ambiance is slightly faded Victoriana, which suits the area perfectly. The common areas -- library, bar, study -- are wonderfully atmospheric. The rooms are quite small, but warm, clean and with all the amenities you'd expect (including Earl Grey with the tea-making facilities: you can tell a lot about a hotel from it's tea). The staff are extremely helpful and informative, and I think would be invaluable if you were a tourist trying to get the best from a short stay in London

Reviews.Title: “Ah, Mr Gulliver, welcome to Lilliput.”
Reviews.Author: Martin503888
Reviews.Content: There was nothing mediocre about this hotel. It was a pretty even split between excellent and really awful! In fairness to the hotel, lets look at the excellent first. The staff were first class. There were lots of them and they were all friendly and attentive. I only had breakfast in the restaurant but with the exception of the occasional cold pot of tea, the food was quickly served, plentiful and delicious. Over all, the cleanliness of the hotel was good including my single room, which you could have tidied, dusted and hoovered without moving from the centre of the room! A little bit of an exageration so lets be brutally honest. Having spent hundreds if not thousands of nights in hotel room across the UK, this was the smallest room I have ever seen by a long stretch. it was no bigger than a prison cell. There was no room for a bed side table, there was no room to put my luggage and the shower was very hard work. I consider myself tall but trim(ish) with a 36" waist and 44" chest. I had to jam myself against the shower wall to close the concertina shower door and I couldn't wash my hair without constantly banging my elbows on the walls. On one occasion I dropped the shampoo and I had to open the shower door to create the room to retrieve it. Most unsatisfactory. I am working in London for the next 5 weeks and despite it being further out from the office, I have booked the Tara Copthorne as I would not consider a return to The Strathmore.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for a Queen (mother)?”
Reviews.Author: mikepa1960
Reviews.Content: This hotel was th former home of the queen mothers parents. You can imagine it as upstairs downstairs in its grander days. The room was fantastic; her adyships ex sitting room I believe. However, they have made nothing of the ballroom restaurant which is a real shame. The waiter was non plussed by 3 tales to cope with and the music background was an old [---] which kept getting stuck! This is a pity becaue otherwise a facinating building.

Reviews.Title: “they charge for a single but offer what they call a "cabin" room”
Reviews.Author: Aritenga
Reviews.Content: For a full-cost booking they put me in in the smallest hotel room I've ever seen (and I've been to Japan). I asked the front desk to find something else; they offered me a foul-smelling basement room with a view of garbage. Third room offered was adequate, although still small, and 3 of 5 light fixtures were nonoperational. The other two had single 40-watt bulbs. Generally it's pretty shabby as well. I mentioned to the concierge and he said "oh, they put you in a cabin room."

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: JP T
Reviews.Content: Never stayed in such sub standard room. Many years ago when I was a student and short of money, I stayed in a Â£6 per night room only offering in the back streets of Blackpool - It was better than this place! I was allocated a room in the basement, next to what I think was the boiler room. Extractor fan in the bathroom did not work, toilet was so close to the wall I had no choice but to sit on it sideways, rips in the wall paper, exposed piping running over the floor, room stupidly small, need I go on - room was not fit for purpose - impossible to sleep as room was too hot because of location. Public areas are shocking - worn out carpet and shabby wall paper, lift barely big enough for one. Complained to reception, they did not want to know. Plenty of hotels on nearby Cromwell Road which are so much better and in the same price range. Totally Disgraceful.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER NEVER book a single room here”
Reviews.Author: craig s
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 night at the strathmore hotel in the smallest room i have ever seen8ft by 7 ft the shower was so small you could not turn around and it was not cheap, i felt like harry potter living under the stairs you have been warned

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Dododog
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in a quiet, elegant, residential square, close to Gloucester Road tube station. A short, pleasant walk to the Victoria and Albert Museum, the Natural History Museum and other places of cultural interest, and to a huge variety of restaurants, pubs and cafes. The hotel has a comfortable lounge with all-night bar service, and offers a sumptuous 'continental' breakfast in the elegant dining room, as well as a full English breakfast for the truly ambitious. The public areas still have much of the grandeur of a historic residence - it's just a lovely place to be. My single room was tiny - if it were any bigger, I imagine the hotel would be vastly more expensive. It was nevertheless adequate, providing you're travelling fairly light (good bed, good shower, good lighting, tv). But prices vary: in my opinion, for around GBP100, including breakfast, the location and ambience offset the shortcomings (smallness) of the room. The staff were outstanding - reception, concierge, restaurant, bar, cleaning staff, night porters - all were attentive, friendly, well-informed, efficient and helpful. A small smoking lounge would have been appreciated by the fairly large group of guests who gathered out in the street - at the very least, an ashtray of some kind! It would also be safer to have the fire doors open outwards instead of inwards.

Reviews.Title: “Tired decor, noisy BUT would stay here again due to price”
Reviews.Author: dollydaydream84
Reviews.Content: Good location for South Kensington, short walk to V&A, Kensington Gardens&Palace, Natural History Museum etc. Lots of bars and restaurants close by. Given how quiet the road that the hotel was on was, I was surprised to be kept awake both nights by people on the road outside (where were they coming from?!) - it was really irritating, especially as the window wouldn't shut properly. The walls were also paper thin and we had the misfortune of having a very amorous couple in the room next to us(!). The continental breakfast included in the price was fine. Although buying it separately, a full english would have been an extra Â£20 which I felt to be a rip off. The bell boy/porter was very pleasant but the rest of the staff less so, and seemed to have trouble understanding what i was asking on several occasions. Wi-fi is approx Â£10 per 24 hours, in this day and age, it should be free. Bags could be left at the hotel after check-out which was a good help to us. The rooms were tiny, seriously, seriously tiny there ws only just enough room to shimmy past the bed on all sides. It was hard to work at the desk with the TV on the desk and the chair was v uncomfy! The decor was a bit dodgy, peely wall paper, dirty grout in the bathroom but the room seemed clean, it was just very tired. The decor is very chintzy - think tartan carpets, it seems in character with the hotel but is tired and just looks naff. Saying ALLLL of this, for Â£70 per room per night in central london, it was a decent hotel. It was int he right location for where I needed to be and I would stay there again. I preffered our stay at The Kingsley in Bloomsbury, but the normal price for that is nearly twice the price of the Grange. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Very sweet & kitchy”
Reviews.Author: Ansik
Reviews.Content: The are is very nice, near a tube station witch is a great plus. Friendly breakfast staff, but the receptions not so much. The hotel is an interesting building, old and charming but also very worn. The room we got was so tiny i could not believe the size of it. The bathroom was in better shape than the wallpapers. We got a very cheap price for the rooms so, its fine. BUT the bed was awful. It was so soft it felt like if it was broken. It was also by the window, so it was very cold in the room. So next time ill pick less quaint place to stay like Easyhotel, as a good nights sleep and comfort of warmness is much more important than Chesterfield sofas in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJH0807
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night during the week as we had a few days away to London to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary. After searching endlessly online for a reasonably priced hotel for just one night in central london somehow I came across The Grange Strathmore Hotel and I really was not disappointed. We were 'around' the corner from Harrods, 5 min walk from the tube station with only a few stops away from our Theatre. The staff were all pleasant and the room was really lovely. If only we'd had longer! and yes I would definetly love stay again. My husband always says I'm snobby....and this hotel was right up my street!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: gamfruit
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through lastminute.com and on arrival I found out that the room was just a bit larger than a closet so I asked for an upgrade. Kasha (friendly Front Desk staff from Poland) said she could offer me a good deal: Â£30 to upgrade to a nice twin room and complimentary continental breakfast. Since hotel dealls from lastminute.com is famous for not including breakfast I asked Kasha again if she was sure she could include breakfast, and she confirmed that she could and she would. The following morning I was confronted by the Duty Manager as a liar when I was about to have my breakfast. I suppose what happened was that Kasha forgot to make a note in the computer, but the Duty Manager (Zusana) wouldn't listen. Anyway I have learned my lesson and the best way to make sure whatever good deal that has been agreed on will happen is to see something in writing.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little Gem in a great Neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Angelina2008_9
Reviews.Content: While visiting London recently, I was reminded of the pleasures of staying in one of Londonâ€™s nicer hotels, the Grange Strathmore, beautifully situated in the fashionable Kensington/Chelsea neighbourhood. The building has maintained the style of an aristocratic mansion and, I understand, is a former residence of the Earl of Strathmore. It is filled with character, old world charm and caring, efficient, employees. As there is little staff turnover, I suspect due to superb management, guests are warmly welcomed and made feel at home. While some may consider rooms not too spacious, from my viewpoint, they are more than adequate, spotlessly clean, with cozy beds, the best of linen and tea/coffee facilities provided. High speed Internet is also available to guests, with complimentary newspapers on the doorstep at the crack of dawn each morning. Breakfast, served in the dining room, is excellent, with lots of choice on the menu and service par excellence. An added bonus is the location, close to all tourist attractions, smart shops, great restaurants, and only a short walk to Gloucester Road tube station. Airport shuttle bus service is easily arranged with the concierge. From my own personal experience, I wouldnâ€™t dream of staying anywhere other than the Grange Strathmore, where management and staff aim to please, with no request unreasonable. Special thanks to an outstanding team!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, staff professional, as one would expect from a 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeFergal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Sunday night after our flight into London was delayed and we missed the last train home. We got a good discount rate, we both had a good night's sleep on a decent bed, the shower was excellent and the breakfast was fine. The room was a little small and, overall, the hotel is a little old and could perhaps do with a bit of renovation - but, then, that's "character" for some people. Would stay here again on a discounted rate, but I don't think it's worth the rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: John3644366
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent within easy walking distance of Gloucester Road tube,giving access to 3 lines.The area is decent with plenty of shops and eateries,the museums are close and Harrods not much further.I had a small single room which was very small,tall travellers may have an issue with this .The room and toilet was clean and there was a good selection of tea/coffee.A couple of faults with the room were sorted out immediately.The hotel is in fairly quiet area and i had no problems sleeping as i requested a quiet room.The plumbing is a bit noisey and the corridor doors make a bit of a bang if not shut carefully but overall i was not disturbed.The staff were friendly and attentive,i did not use the expensive restaurant and there was no pressure to do so.Overall i would recommend this hotel to travellers looking for a good location to explore London.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst 4* in London”
Reviews.Author: AUKTourist
Reviews.Content: The Grange Strathmore Hotel, is a small hotel which has been converted from a residential property. So no surprise that everything is on a smaller scale. I had a double room on the 5th floor, basically the servants quarters in the attic. Small with everything you need, but very very compact. I was only here for one night but managed. If you are visiting London for more than 2 days then do your research, if you need a large room look elsewhere, but be prepared to pay for it. My room was very clean and quiet. Be aware there is no air conditioning so its open windows in summer, with road traffic and the noise from Heathrow. If you want to be near the museums and great shopping and do not mind small rooms, then this could be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: tyler_cp
Reviews.Content: Even though I recommend this hotel, I'll start with the (few) cons first: 1) smaller room (by American standards); and 2) you hear more noise than you should, from the hallway. However: 1) it's in a great location on the Piccadilly metro line, and close to major shopping in Knightsbridge. It's not central, but still in the western edge of "zone one"; 2) the staff are overly friendly and helpful; 3) the rooms are quite nice and well-furnished; 4) the bathroom was very good. My friend and I agreed that the water pressure in the shower was excellent; 5) the front desk and lobby are comfortable and well kept. 6) for the quality of the hotel, the price was cheap compared to

Reviews.Title: “Good price and great location”
Reviews.Author: katyford
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we needed a hotel within walking distance to the Albert Hall. This fitted the bill perfectly for the price and was only a 10min walk. It was also literally 2/3mins from the Natural History Museum. Our room was downstairs so very dark, but spacious and clean. The bed was pretty hard and one of the least comfortable I have slept in in a hotel (for me personally) but we got a room at a bargain price of Â£114, which is very good for the area. The nearest tube station is Gloucester Road and the hotel is only a 5min walk from there. It took us a while to find it as it is not well signed. It is just up from Fraser Place on the other side of the road, but the only signs are brass signs on the columns outside. Definitely recommend if you are looking for a cheaper hotel in a great location. It isn't far from the main Gloucester Road but you don't hear any traffic from the room. There is also a Boots and some cheaper food places (KFC/Burger King) nearby by the tube station if you are on a bit of a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Been there before, won't go back”
Reviews.Author: Traveldork39
Reviews.Content: Concierge men were very helpful. Good customer service there. However, traveled 12 hours overseas to get there, phones in rooms weren't working, needed to call to confirm a reservation to another hotel for another stay on trip and receptionist told me to go down the street to find a pay phone. She didn't know where one was! Thank goodness the concierge made the call for me from his phone! The hotel was clean, beds comfortable, but walls need repainting and repair. It's falling apart. Too bad because this was my 4th stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Michele11111
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, and i have stayed here several times. And coming August we will be staying here again. The rooms are tidy and clean, and staff helpfull. Once we had very loud neighbours, and the following day we were given another room. We are looking forward staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Size of the room was scaled for smurfs”
Reviews.Author: TijsVB
Reviews.Content: Just came home from my business trip in London in this hotel. Reservation made by my company to attend a congress @ Earls Court. + Let's start with something positive because all the rest will be rather negative: ConciÃ«rges were friendly and at first sight from outside; the building is charming and the location is ok. BUT - The room did not match at all the description (CAPS) we received. SUP SGL BED 24 SQUARE/METER? The small (SUPERIOR) bed was really uncomfortable and sank in to the middle and size of the room was should have been 7 sq/ m INTERNET DESK? no place to put my laptop on the desk, and extra cost for internet: 10 pound for 24hours consecutive? Most hotels that i've visited, the price was reasonable or even incl. No wifi? CABLE TV: 6 channels on the cable... BATH SHOWER? only "shower", size of the shower: 45cm45/cm Bathroom was rather small, you have to open the door of the shower if you wanted to sit comfortably on the toilet. BUFFET BREAKFAST? continental: call it a basic breakfast (even @ home I do have more choice), eggs are not incl. -> English:extra 5 pounds. Go for your breakfast to a bar and you will get value for money. I went to the reception and showed the description of my reservation. - What a customer friendly hotel would do: apologize, there have been a mistake, and correct the mistake (and in the back: check out what has happened and correct the description if that would have been the mistake) - What Grange Hotel has done: Reception: there has been a mistake, (what they have said) the description is wrong (description for a double room) and they would have called the travel agency to check. If I wanted to complain, I had to take the action myself by asking for the Hotel Manager the next day and to discuss this. Because she was not there... (I did not had the time to discuss on the day of the checkout) I escalated this in the morning and in the evening, I expected an action not the kind of reaction they have given. Room was dirty (under my bed). Tiles in my bathroom on the ground were moving. NOT for people who are having claustrophobia. 1 small elevator suitable for 5 persons: (read: 5 smurfs) This is not what I expect and accept from a 4? stars Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Why is it 4 star???”
Reviews.Author: gmn2743
Reviews.Content: I can't really understand why this is classed as a 4 star hotel. It's cramped & tatty & desperately needs an overhaul. Stayed for 2 nights recently. Got a twin room with just about enough space for 2 single beds. As a previous reviewer says, internet (no wifi) rates were extortionate Â£5/hour or Â£10/day. Breakfast was too...so we didn't go for it. On the plus side, the location is excellent. A stones throw from Gloucester road tube station which is easily reached from Heathrow. Staff were friendly enough & we got a good deal on lastminute.com If they advertised as 3-star, then you'd be getting what you expect.....

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel lacking basic features”
Reviews.Author: hs4089
Reviews.Content: Despite the price, the rooms at this hotel are incredibly small. I have a tiny desk but no chair. No air conditioning and the room is stifling even in April. No complimentary water - I could boil to death in this room. No WIFI and Intenet charges are extortionate. Most business hotels deliver WIFI for free or low cost. English is not the first language of the staff leading to confusion about the room number I was allocated and to my horror I realised my room key could unlock more than one room. This is a very old hotel with lots of creaking floorboards and tatty carpets.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a short stay in London”
Reviews.Author: superali99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grange Strathmore for one night wth my husband while we were in London for an appointment. We arrived by taxi, so no problem to find the place and we are reasonably familiar with London so recognised the general area. The hotel is in the Borough of Kensington and Chelsea so is very convenient for things like Harrods, Natural History Museum, Victoria, Chelsea Barracks and Sloane Square. The hotel is in an old building that has been refurbished, like a lot of hotels in central London so expect narrow corridors and creaky floorboards. The decor is Scottish in theme with plenty of tartan drapes and carpeting, which we appreciated being Scottish but you do get the sense of it being somewhat dated in appearance. The reception area is tiny but the staff were very helpful and checked us in very quickly. We were upgraded to a family room free of charge which sat on the corner and had one double bed and two single beds and a sitting area, so we really were spoiled. The bed was very comfortable, although it could be argued that this is due to an old and saggy mattress - for us it was perfect, but I could understand if others who prefer a firmer bed would struggle. The room was very warm so we opened the window wide to get some fresh air, but I didn't sleep very well partly because we were on the first floor and I was concerned about someone coming in through the window overnight. The shower and bathroom facilities were excellent and we had no problems checking out the next morning. We left our bags with the concierge for the day because we were going out and about in London before catching our flight and again this was no problem and free of charge. The breakfast was OK, but quite standard. A small continental selection of croissants and bread rolls, salami, cheddar, ham and processed cheese squares. It does what you need and there is also the cooked breakfast option which was spot on. Nothing fancy, it's not the best breakfast in the world, but it fills you up and the coffee was hot and strong, so we had no major problems. One thing to note is that the rooms do not have individual safes and you are told that there is a safety deposit box available at reception. We took our small 15" Vaio laptop down to put in and it wouldn't fit in the box, also there are a very limited number of boxes so I'm not sure what you then do if there are none left. I don't think it would take too much investment to put safes in the rooms that would leave you with more peace of mind that your valuables were taken care of. The hotel is located about 4 minutes walk from Gloucester Road tube station that is on the Circle/District line and three stops from Victoria station. We ate and drank in the Strathmore Arms pub opposite the tube station and it was excellent, the best fish and chips we have had in a long time. Overall, a pleasant night's stay and we would be happy to stay for one or two nights, but not longer or you might get a migraine from the tartan!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: gaddass
Reviews.Content: Great concierge,very professional and as good as you could hope for,let down by reception an Asian girl with bad grasp of English and even less of the hotels rules.Near enough insisted I leave a 100-00 deposit,even suggesting a cash point around the corner when I said I didn't have a credit card,she was in the end corrected by the other receptionist a surly and uninterested character as you could dread to meet.. Tiny room with a window anyone less than 6'4" couldn't see out of even on tiptoes(5th floor). Ive marked it 5 from 5 for cleanliness as it was immaculate clean even to my wife whos a executive housekeeper for another hotel but shower had cracked tiles and mildew in the silicon sealant. Breakfast expensive if not included and only passable(continental supposedly but no eggs) Considering location and we got a good deal for 2 nights(160ish) Id stay again,quiet and near museums I was visiting not far from tube and decent cheap and expensive restaurants in walking distance,any negatives mentioned were infact not too bad as we spent little time in the room and the service from the concierge gave the feel of a better hotel than we'd paid for. If you can get a good deal including breakfast and dont stay in room much then probably a better bet than many others. Very expensive wireless internet,5-00 hour must be taken in 1hr slots used in one go or 10-00 a day

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jane1048
Reviews.Content: Used the hotel as a base for a theatre trip weekend & was very pleased with the choice. We had lovely rooms, clean with very comfy beds and the staff were so friendly and could not do enough for us. We upgraded our breakfast to the full english for an extra Â£6 each and was not disappointed, food was hot and really tasty. Would definately stay again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: blacksmithgolf
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend break at this hotel. The deal was booked through a travel group was ro include a free upgrade of room. (subject to availability) On check in I made this known to the receptionist who said she would do what she could. Unfortunately we were told that there were no upgrades available for the two night package.(strange there was for one night) On entering our room No 214 I was absolutely furious. The room was very small and the bed was positioned along side the window which meant you had to climb over your partner to get in and out of the bed as there was very little room between the wardrobe and bottom of bed. We were in a rush to get to the theatre so therfore let it pass. Don't get me wrong the room was clean, tidy, all laundry and towels freshly laundered but the room and bathroom was extremely pokey. My husband kept saying it was only a place to rest our heads and we would hardly be in the room. Staff were lovely and consierge and waitresses very helpful its just such a shame we got that room. Breakfast quality good. Great location as tube is really close by and also some lovely restaurants in the area. If we ever go back will make sure we get a room were you can enter the bed from both sides.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped and cold but the staff are friendly”
Reviews.Author: C_F_D1992
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel but wouldn't recommend it. I've stopped in more comfortable Holiday Inn's and even Travel Lodges within London. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The hotels communal spaces were rather grand with an interior that is in keeping with the buildings exterior. The room however looked like it had once been bigger and had been divided into two smaller rooms by the way the coving and the positioning of the windows (being in the corner of the room as opposed to the typical central positioning). The room was incredibly small and there was just enough room for a walkway around the beds from the window to the door. The beds Weren't especially comfortable and the bathroom was rather basic but still clean. The room was really cold and even though I turned the radiator to the highest setting it did little to keep this old building ( with things like original single glazed windows - nice but only with efficient heating in place , this is England! ) warm and I ended up getting extra blankets from the cupboard out but it was still rather cold. The breakfast at the hotel was nice but once again basic with continental being offered. As mentioned the staff were all friendly and helpful but the rooms to this hotel are cold, small and could do with a touch of modernising. ( I understand the period theme but plugs by the bedside , I thought, basic to every hotel in the world - lamps, phones ect need them. But no the only plug ( yes plug as in only one spare, without unplugging T.V ect) was by the desk at the end of the beds. There was no Wi-fi option at this hotel and it was cable only and their internet prices were rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, excellent service, fantastic food, great location and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: Natties123
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for Valentines night this year after finding an excellent package online. After reading some really negative reviews of the hotel on here I was fairly anxious about our stay, especially as I am quite fussy! However I was over the moon with our stay. The hotel is very beautiful but it is quite run down in terms of decor, but we had a huge room with lovely views, incredibly comfortable bed, soft towels, lovely bathroom products etc. We had a gorgeous supper in the restaurant, smoked salmon that was full of flavour and roast lamb with Mediterranean vegetables which was incredible - beautifully cooked and the quality of the ingredients was top notch, it was just a shame that we were 1 of only 2 couples using the restaurant We ordered breakfast in our room the next day which was huge and again perfect! The staff throughout our stay were charming, very helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend staying here. We had room 412 I believe so ask for this if you can! I really felt for this hotel as it deserves to be packed! It's a 2 minute walk from the tube station and 2 minutes to National History Museum etc so great for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “standard double rooms are tiny!”
Reviews.Author: travelcritz
Reviews.Content: - This hotel is in a good location near museums and Gloucester Road tube station but the double standard rooms are very very small and definitely not for the claustrophic - this was the smallest room I have ever stayed in and was very challenging when two adults were trying to get ready at the same time - The wardrobe (also tiny) could only store 7 coathangers - Ensuite bathroom was the tiny too but had a bath and good shower - Price was not any cheaper than a normal sized room at any other hotel + The room service was excellent and reasonably priced. - Bar drinks were expensive + The room was lovely and warm and the window was easy to open - The spare pillows were both dirty - one with drool then other with mascara, however the staff sorted this quickly - The breakfast was not included in our rate, but was available at Â£17 - however we found a delicious little patisserie (opposite Gloucester Road Tube) and had smoked salmon and scrambled eggs for Â£4 or full english for Â£8 - and the freshly queezed orange juice was delicious so were the croissants

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel- can't see why there are bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Shab123
Reviews.Content: Firstly I dont understand the bad reviews!! It was lOvely! We stayed at the grange strathmore on feb 12th 2011, the staff were friendly and welcoming as we walked in! They assisted us efficiently and the hotel itself is really nice if you like the old fashioned style which we did! It's not modern but is almost like a Victorian style hotel! So don't come here if u like modern hotels!! Our room was really clean and well presented, slightly smaller than we thought but still again really nice! Breakfast in the morning was really nice, fresh efficient and Cooked to our liking!! The only downside to it was that the hotel is extremely hot!! Very hot so keeping a window open is essential!! Comfy beds too!! Overall it was a lovely clean old fashioned hotel with friendly staff and I would say it was an almost perfect 4star hotel- the heating just needs altering and also a better sign outside to state where it is!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad in Executive Room-Hotel very run down.”
Reviews.Author: Dave0242
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted somewhere near the Albert Hall. This hotel is just a few minutes walk from there. After booking through an agency we looked at Trip Advisor. Several reports spoke of small, shabby rooms, and a run down look to the Hotel. As a precaution I booked an Executive Room (Â£60) for two nights.The room was ok except for a water stain in the corner of the Ceiling. In the Lounge it was so dark that you could not read a paper. Tried the Restaurant and ordered Duck. It arrived as a slab of Duck with a bit of red cabbage nothing else-Â£16. The coffee was undrinkable. The lift is erratic and broke down for most of an evening. The Continental Breakfast was ok and a cooked alternative was available at Â£5 extra per person.The staff were from a variety of backgrounds and none were of English origin. On arrival the Receptionist insisted on a Â£40 deposit against charges even though we had booked through an agency. I protested that this was most unusual(a copy of a card is adequate for most hotels that we visit) despite speaking to the Duty Manager they insisted on it. The Hotel is not of four star status and needs a major refurbishment-we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Boggsie
Reviews.Content: Poor customer service. Deeply unpleasant experience. Poor soundproofing. Dirty, grime covered shower head came off in my hand. Small, threadbare towels. Croissants stale. They gave me my money back, I would not however recommend them to anyone. In only positive I can come up with is that the hotel is a 3 minute walk from the tube. Oh, and there's one waiter in the restaurant who is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Makeover Needed ASAP”
Reviews.Author: SamNicks
Reviews.Content: Old, Run Down - booked it via Top Secret on Last Minute - boy did we get a surprise! After staying in The Grange St Pauls we expected so much more. Small, Old and dank - our room heard every conversation in adjacent rooms! We were glad to stay here only one night...On the plus side the concierge was attentive and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Overinflated opinion of itself”
Reviews.Author: Balthasaar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at a good rate (Â£65) as it was a Secret Hotel on LastMinute.com, but the price was the only virtue. This really is a 3* hotel masquerading as a 4*, with the faded tartan carpet and faintly bemused staff. Our room was small but adequate, and the night's sleep fine. However, the really unforgivable thing about the accommodation and stay is that the bathroom had no heater, nothing. No radiator/vent/space heater/collection of candles - and a single glazed window. It was like an icebox in December, and complete unacceptable for any standard of hotel. This hotel could be a really nice little 4* in a good location, but unfortunately it's a worn down old building which is only worth going to as a last minute discounted stop gap.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: nimacolu
Reviews.Content: Me and my 11 year old daughter sayed here for 3 nights. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the location close to tube was very good. Breakfast was not included and in my mind too expensive so we had breakfast at Starbucks very close by. We found a last minute deal and it was very good value for money. comfortable rooms really nothing to complain about. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: kirka35
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good area on a quiet street just 4 minutes from the tube station. It is only 2-3 stops (10-15 minutes) away from Oxford street. Internet is extra, no gym, no refrigerator in the room, more like a budget hotel: The stuff overall is friendly and you can tell they are not getting paid a lot. Hotel has different types of rooms: very small rooms and nice big size rooms, so make sure you pay a little extra but get the bigger room because the small one is really depressing. I wish the owners of the hotel will invest some funds and fix it up since it has a lot of potential.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: shel4you
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay here. Room was very nice and stylish Staff were lovely. Good location very close to underground. Lots of places to have coffee and many restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room In need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: max09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here whilst visiting London, in August, having stayed some months ago in the Grange St Pauls which was a nice hotel at a good price. The Strathmore was very disappointing by comparison. We were allocated a tiny room on the top floor with barely room to walk round the bed. It must have been the servants quarters at one time but we paid about Â£280 for two weekend nights. There was nowhere to put a suitcase and the wallpaper was hanging off in one corner due to a roof leak. The mould behind the paper proved this had been ongoing for some time. There was no aircon so the room was stuffy even with the windows open. The plaster had fallen off the corridor ceiling due to further roof leaks and during a heavy shower water was running from the leak onto electrical equipment. Clearly the roof problems were not new as some bits had been patched before but were not painted. The bathroom was tiny with very poor tiling. The carpets in the circulation areas were tired and worn in places. One tricky feature was that the room price was initially quoted without VAT !!! The only redeeming feature was the pleasant helpful staff. The hotel may be well located for my needs but it offers poor value in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great, just what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: amanda5356
Reviews.Content: This hotel was, as described on Trip Adviser, a great place to stay. We had a very comfortable night with the most friendly and helpful staff we could have wished for. Quiet and clean and convenient, what more can I say! The breakfast is outrageously expensive, but not compulsory, although we did have a very nice continental breakfast at Â£17 per head!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: twistedwheelnut
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere to stay for one night because we were going to a show at the Albert Hall. This hotel was on lastminute as a "Secret Hotel". The location is absolutely fantastic - right near to Gloucester Road tube station, lots of nice bars and restaurants, and just a short walk to Hyde Park and the Albert Hall. We were given a basement room (maybe because we got it cheap as a Secret Hotel?), but the room was a good size, spottlessly clean, with a good bathroom and, even though it was underground, had 4 windows, so was quite light and airy. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was not included in our room rate but was available at Â£25 per person... not surprisingly, we decided against paying so much and ate a gorgeous breakfast at one of the many local cafe bars instead. Overall, a nice hotel, in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Indiemandm
Reviews.Content: The hotel was immaculate, the rooms are small but have everything you need. Good restaurants just round the corner and easy walking distance of the Science Museum, V & A and Natural History. Open top bus tour from the tube station which is within two minutes walk. It was hot when we visited and there is no air conditioning but a fan was provided and the window opened. It would be lovely and cosy in winter although we probably wouldn't go in the middle of summer again. The staff were polite and friendly and the price was excellent for such a central location. The only money we had to spend on travelling was to and from the train station. Harrods is also within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money & clean & friendly too.”
Reviews.Author: vanillalatte72
Reviews.Content: We booked to see Mamma Mia & thought it a good Idea to have a couple of nights in a Hotel, took a chance on this hotel as the price was reasonable & in the right area, also it was a mystery hotel so didn't know what to expect. I was really happy when I saw our twin room , the beds was so comfy & the room was spotless.... The bathroom was really nice & like everything in the room clean, walk in shower ( just what I required) the only thing I didn't like about the shower was that the shower was fixed to the wall... apart form that everything was absolutely fab. The staff was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: leelee101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this beautiful hotel for what was meant to be 1 night however the service and room was so nice we ended up staying for 5 nights, we didnt book a hotel when we booked our tickets and thought we would just find something when we arrived.... i am so glad we did, we came across this lovely hotel in a little book and thought what the heck.... The staff were so accommodating and when we decided to extend our stay they were more than helpful. We did have to change rooms but we were not charged any more and they moved all of our luggage for us. Not only did we extend once but we extended a second time and we were then given the best room in the hotel for the same price as a standard double. Breakfast was light but lovely and the quaint lounge was perfect after we walked all over london, to come back to and enjoy a scotch in a lovely leather lounge, definatley felt like home..Walking distance to Kensington Palace, Glouchester Station and many lovely old little taverns. Thankyou Grange Strathmore we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a suitable hotel in London!”
Reviews.Author: BelgianfromOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grange Strathmore in Kensington for 4 nights at the beginning of July. I had stayed the year before at the Grange Westminster, and liked the chain enough to try another. These are "historical" hotels within stately houses, thus with a lot of cachet and atmosphere. I preferred the Grange Strathmore mainly for the proximity to the subway (with three different lines, including the most important one if you want to go to theaters and restaurants in Covent Garden/Soho/Chinatown at night: Piccadilly line), a mere five minutes walk. The hotel is in a very nice residential street, just a few steps away from shops and the subway. The neighbourhood itself (Kensington) was quite a discovery; the architecture and mews were great to discover. The streets have so much appeal that just walking there is a visit in itself (not to mention the second-hand clothes stores, because this is a very rich neighbourhood...). Chelsea is just below, on the way to the Thames, and worth a visit too; Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park just above. The location was ideal. The staff was very friendly. I was a little concerned about the absence of climatisation in July (this was a very hot July throughout Europe), but my friend and I were given a room on the 5th floor with two angle windows: with the air at night, it was perfect. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room, although small (but this is London), was very well organized and the furniture, well chosen and matching the cozy/antique style of the hotel. The breakfast room was awesome, airy and never overcrowded (probably one of the nicest rooms of the hotel with the bar; this is where you get the historical feel). The buffet (continental) suited our needs perfectly. This is the first time I felt wholly happy in a London hotel. I do not think I will go elsewhere if I go to London again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & pleasant”
Reviews.Author: gamfruit
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, especially Ula. Very helpful. Made my stay there very enjoyable. The room I stayed in was very comfortable. Nice location. Pleasant experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladyandgent
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The rooms felt a bit old but the character of the hotel made up for this. We found the location to be perfect for our needs and all the staff very pleasant. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KikiWiig
Reviews.Content: This is as far away from "Victorian grandour and contemporary luxury" as you can get! We checked in late one Thursday evening and was shown to a room not much bigger than a stamp. And to ad insult to injury it had no aircondition! It was steaming hot. The day after we asked and got another room, in the basement! But at least it was much bigger and cooler. Non of the rooms we got to see looked remotely like the pictures on the web site. The rooms were clean enough but terribly worn. The bed in our first room was lumpy, the next one was hard. There were no goodies in the bathroom and the cealing had dark spots. And nothing luxurious about them at all. You have to pay to get internet access. We did not have breakfast because they charged Â£ 23 for English breakfast. Ridiculous! I would rather pay than stay here again and I feel truly sorry for people who have booked ths and are looking forward to a nice stay in London. If they said it was a 2- 3* hotel it would be more realistic but then the price would be way to high! The consierge did not even bother to help us with our luggage down the stairs when we checked out! My only advise is: don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel for 13 Ukrainian Delegation”
Reviews.Author: NormOfAlbania
Reviews.Content: We've just completed our visit to the UK from 13 Ukrainian delegates who stayed at the Strathmore Hotel, Kensington. Generally the consensus was that the hotel is functional and well located near Gloucester Road tube station. The bedrooms are of a decent size, but I found my bed a little uncomfortable and squeaky! Not a big issues with me, but for a couple... well, you know. I was pleased with the staff on reception, I was greeted with friendly service and no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely compact room - 3/4 bed”
Reviews.Author: TheIntrepidConnerys
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a lastminute.com secret room and the rate was the same as the hotels own website. The staff were really helpful and friendly and gave us a warm welcome when we arrived late on a Sunday evening. Our room was 005 in the basement, it was extremely compact, with a 3/4 bed advertised as a double room. It was nicely furnished and very clean. Ideal if you get it for a bargain price, and don;t intend to spend much time in it! The location is great. There is no air conditioning and I was really concerned about security having leaving the window open, as we were on the ground floor and the gate to the basement area was left open. This is also the area where the staff congregate to smoke, have a chat, dump laundry bags, access the sheds for cleaning materials and sit on the window sill from 7 am! So don't expect a lie in!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel, avoid the basement rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: ElScorchio
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my girlfriend for 3 days in early june. The hotel manager placed us in the infamous room 007 in the basement. It is the worst of the worst rooms I have ever seen. I made a complaint 10 minutes later, but they just kept saying the hotel was full. The 2 different hotel managers we encountered during our 3 day stay were extremly unhelpfull and had problems communicating in plain english. We had to sleep with the main door open into the hall, just to get som air into the room - how safe is that in the middle of London?? Didn't try the breakfast as they charge too much. Only positive thing about the hotel were the night porters who worked there. They served us cold beer and fair prices during th whole night in the bar. They also gave some ghost stories about the hotel, but we didn't experience anything creepy (trust me, living in the basement is creepy enough because you feel you are going to suffocate). And also, the location of the hotel in London is very nice. If they could have spent a little money fixing the place up, it would be perfect. But I am afraid that this hotel is a weak 3-star at the most, far far far from being anywhere near a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not for internet users”
Reviews.Author: Raptor4649
Reviews.Content: The rooms were fine and staff were friendly. Kind of have a beat up look to the whole hotel - especially the carpets. I was most disappointed in their internet facilities. For starters, they charge for internet access at Â£5 an hour and Â£10 per 24 hours. I like to have video conversations with my fiance so this extra cost was unexpected and annoying. If the internet connection was ultra fast then I would not have anything to complain about, but it was slow and unreliable. Websites took forever to load if there were too many images or ads, and the connection would just spontaneously drop if I'm on skype phone. Video conversations are not possible. In this time and age when internet access is not a luxury but a necessity, I don't think there is any justification for charging for internet at their rate...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, average rooms and value for London”
Reviews.Author: MellieBe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grange Strathmore for 3 nights. The service was incredibly friendly and cordial and the location was amazing (easy subway access, a few blocks to museums and shopping). Other than that, the value wasn't spectacular - rooms were tight, breakfast was overpriced ($30 each) and pretty limited, and of course internet was a pricey extra. Definitely not bad but not amazing - not sure if I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: The-Bradshaws2010
Reviews.Content: We arrived before our room was ready, the staff took our luggage so we could go out and to our suprise they rang us to say our room was ready. The room was clean and a nice size, the bed was very comfortable and we sleept well. Breakfast was lovely we had full english and we never had to ask for toast or a coffee refill. We found the hotel to be in a great location lots of cafe's and places to eat also within walking distance of the tube and the the Royal Albert Hall. We are coming back to stay again in August. Nice staff, very clean, fantastic location what more can you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling! Tiny room in basement and had to share a double bed!”
Reviews.Author: underthetropicalsun
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I were booked in the Grange Strathmore for 3 nights as we had to work in London. When we arrived we were told that our room was a double, not a twin. We objected as although we are friends (as we work together) we didn't want to share a bed! They said that there was a hen night on and that they had no spare rooms so we would have to share the room or find somewhere else. We didn't want to spend ages trying to find another hotel so took the double room on the promise that we would be 'upgraded' to a twin the next day. The manager then told us we had to go down to our room - so we were helped with our luggage to the basement. when we got to our room (room 007) it was the tiniest hotel room I have ever been in. There was a smaller than normal double bed and it was boiling hot in there (it was a hot weekend). There was NO AIR CONDITIONING and the only window opened out to under the fire escape!!!!! There wasn't very much point in opening the window. The shower was tiny and there was no extractor fan to remove the hot air! We complained immediately - it was so hot and we had to share a bed - there was no air coming through the room but they again said that there were no spare rooms. After a really uncomfortable night (it was so hot and we had to sleep with clothes on as we were sharing a bed. I had a shower and felt like I was going to pass out as it was so hot. We had to prop the door open so we could dry our hair without being ridiculously hot! We went up for breakfast and no-one came to ask us what we wanted. In fairness they did move us to a twin room and gave us free breakfasts after we complained a lot. However the bathroom in the new room didn't have an extractor fan either which made it unbearably hot to be in when having a shower. The majority of the staff were nice but a lot of the time we felt the managers just fobbed us off with excuses. They also said we had to pay for the internet until I complained to the manager. They shouldn't be allowed to rent out room 007 - it was appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, comfortable and friendly, very good location”
Reviews.Author: lovfam
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my daughter, visiting relatives in London, last weekend, we booked thro last minute.com and had an excellent deal. it worked out at Â£42 a night each over three nights. The room was small but perfectly formed with en-suite bathroom, large tv, plenty of tea and coffee with a kettle. The beds were very comfortable and the room quiet. The hotel is situated about 5 minutes from Gloucester tube station, one road back from the main throughfare of Kensington. We were about 15 minutes walk from Kensington Palace - where we had a lovely picnic in the park - Waitrose is about 5 minutes walk from the hotel. I an thoroughly recommend this hotel, it was comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful, the sitting room and bar for guests was spacious and the bar food menu was very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Practical, good location, not 4*”
Reviews.Author: whizzylala
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on this hotel and it suited our needs well - somewhere to sleep for a few nights whilst visiting London. It is not 4*, there is nothing luxurious about it! Our twin room was small but clean and functional. There was no fridge, a small kettle with the usual teas coffees. Shower was excellent. Staff friendly although we didn't have much to do with them. Very well located, quick walk to tube, hyde park a 10 min walk away. I would return but only at the lastm minute price we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: R8KDJ
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the hotel while visiting the Royal Albert Hall. The location is great for this. Whilst I agree that the Radisson may be superior, we found this hotel adequate for a one night stop over. The room was spacious, king size bed with a good shower. It's dated, but not as bad as some I've stayed in, in London. The thing with all Grange hotels is that they are over rated. Their 5* should be 4* and their 4* hotels should be 3*... Our rate was room only, so we can't say if the food was good or not. I don't think this hotel has air conditioning. If you're staying in the summer, I would double check as we had the windows open from the moment we arrived until we left as it's not a very airy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean and comfortable hotel - good location and very charming.”
Reviews.Author: Gypsum
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just round the corner from the Natural History museum, and the area is very safe and pleasant, and convenient for the underground. The reception area is small and unimpressive, however the drawing room, breakfast room and bedrooms more than make up for this. The bedrooms are clean with very comfortable beds, and look to have been updated recently (the decor is by no means 'boutique' contemporary, but is very nice, nonetheless). We had a flat screen tv in our room, as well as tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom was very nice, with complimentary toiletries, great shower and nice fluffy towels! We didn't opt for breakfast as we thought it was too expensive. The drawing room and breakfast room are very traditional in decor, which I thought added to it's charm, although I would say that this hotel is more a three star than a four - however the price was more three star, so it averaged out! I'd recommend this hotel to anyone - it's everything you want from a hotel, and we thought it was a real find - we'd stay here again, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: sueWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a work colleague. Single room, which was a reasonable size for central London, although the bathroom was a bit on the small side. One breakfast was included and there was a good selection of food. I was not prepared to pay the high cost for breakfast on the other mornings. Staff were friendly and professional. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, architectural beauty and cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: pseudonomad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here two times and would definately stay here again Centrally located-2 min walk to Gloucester rd station Nearby shopping/cafe facilities Beautiful building Rooms well decorated Hearty breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Very Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: LimerickGirlIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a 4 star. Heating did not work in our room. I felt the service was poor when I complained. We were given a portable heater after second call to reception. This was unsatisfactory as we had to wait for room to heat up after being out for the day. There were some loose tiles in the bathroom, and we found a beetle crawling around the bathroom floor twice. This is the reason I rated so badly on cleanliness The room service menu was very poor, choice of salad or sandwiches. The decor in the hotel was shabby. Carpets were very worn in places. The rooms had been recently renovated but the finish was bad. Loose tiles in bathroom and badly laid tiles. The ceiling was bubbly near the window which made me think there could have been a problem with damp. Worst hotel breakfast I have ever had. Â£24 for the Full English and Â£16 for the Continental. Very bad quality, the pastries were stale, and the fry looked like it had been in the kitchen for quite a while. Would never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in First class location with bed to match”
Reviews.Author: DarrellNI
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights and the rooms are small but well furnished and the bed we had was unmatched except by the Hilton in New York at Â£250 per night. We got the hotel at a good rate on Last minute.com and were well pleased with the result. The location is very convenient for the tube at Gloucester Road and also a quick walk up the Cromwell Road to Knightsbridge. Staff were helpful and friendly and the old fashioned rooms are a delight, although an open fire in the lounge would make it even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great old charm hotel in good London location”
Reviews.Author: ChocksSydney
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a great location - easy walking distance to good tube line, just round the corner from museums. The whole hotel (including rooms) is well appointed, with plush furnishings and sumptuous couches. The room was a bit on the small side â€“ but space is at a premium in London â€“ you get what you pay for. As far as value for money goes, I would definitely recommend this. And as far as helpfulness and friendly staff, well, some things you just canâ€™t put a price on â€“ the staff were great, and NOTHING was too much trouble. Very refreshing to find a hotel that really DOES want to improve your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, good service, small and hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: Behar1124
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel during New Years Eve. The staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. They made breakfast for us at 3:30 in the morning before we caught our early flight. The rooms were tiny, but cozy. Biggest complaint was that internet access cost 10 Pounds every 24 hours. I would not stay there again, only for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “i would never come again !”
Reviews.Author: mohd0
Reviews.Content: though the hotel is well located in central london in a quite resedential area, staff are more than happy to extend their help whenever you need, despite all that, i DO NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. First of all, the hotel is old, clearly needs a complete make over, dirty and rooms sizes are extra small (they are smaller than you may expect). this is the first time i review a hotel online, the reason i did that is how bad this hotel was, i have literlay found insicts and bugs in my bed (to be fair, when i told the recepotion about the bugs probelm they immedialty moved me to another room). all in all, do not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad value for money - tiny, cramped surroundings.”
Reviews.Author: discreetgirl
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at this hotel again! For what I paid for it (and considering it's a 4* - the only thing that was 4* about it were its prices - Â£23.50 for a full English, Â£18 for continental!) I was very disappointed. The room was cramped - and in the basement. We were constantly kept awake my the gurgling of the pipes and were far, far too warm. The tiny, grotty window only opened slightly, which didn't give much relief. Not exactly clear where the reception was, either. It's in quite a nice area though. About the only good thing going for it. The people at reception seemed friendly, if a bit careless - and rather more interested in having a good time with their chums than in serving customers.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel for both location and service”
Reviews.Author: ExDabber
Reviews.Content: We couldn't fault the service, location, cleanliness or breakfast and would certainly strongly recommend it. The only slight downside was that the room was a little on the small side - although very well presented. The staff were excellent. Very close to National History Museum, Science Museum and V&A.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny”
Reviews.Author: mkb218
Reviews.Content: So, I had to take a business trip to London. The dates of the trip shifted back and forth, until two weeks before I was to leave the dates finally settled on Fashion Week. This made hotels scarce and expensive (I think around 200 pounds a night). PROS FIRST: - Bed was comfortable, shower was hot, room and bathroom were clean - Near a number of good restaurants and the tube. - Staff was nice enough. CONS: - Thin walls - Internet connection was completely broken. - Old CRT television that got terrible reception. Fortunately I had my computer and DVDs. - Everything closes up early in this neighborhood. - Don't bother with breakfast at the hotel. You'll get $oaked. Errr, bÂ£ed? - Computer maps confuse Queen's Gate and Queen's Gate Gardens, leading me to a private residence.
